Title: SEFE joins Jera, Inpex in urging FERC to fast-track CP2 LNG’s approval
Description: Germany’s state-owned energy company Securing Energy for Europe (SEFE) has become the third company to urge the US Federal Energy Regulatory Commission to approve the proposed 20 mtpa CP2 LNG project in Louisiana in a timely fashion, seeking the authority’s help to expedite the project’s development to ensure Germany’s energy security.
Author: JS

Title: BP asks FERC to intervene in dispute with Venture Global over Calcasieu Pass LNG start-up
Description: BP has asked the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC) for assistance in a dispute with LNG plant developer Venture Global, asking the authority to force the developer to disclose details on the force majeure (FM) that is delaying the start of commercial operations of its 10 mtpa Calcasieu Pass LNG plant in Louisiana in the US.
Author: JS
